statement.p: In 54.55 of the last 22 days it rained. How many days did it not rain? days

solution.p: We recall that a percent as a decimal is part/whole. Here that is \displaystyle\frac{{P}}{{22}}={0.5455}. We solve for P by multiplying by \displaystyle{22}. \displaystyle{P}={0.5455}\cdot{22}={12.001}. We round that as requested to 12 to find the days it rained. How many days did it NOT rain?
